A4.text: Mendel was an Austrian biologist, meteorologist, mathematician, Augustinian friar and abbot of St. Thomas' Abbey in Brno (Br√ºnn), Margraviate of Moravia, and gained posthumous recognition as the founder of the modern science of genetics.

A5.text: Notably, Charles Darwin was not aware of Mendel's paper.
